page.title: 07THE DISUSED RAILWAY
page.content: The railway which used to come to RAUNDS was the Kettering to Cambridge line. It was built about 1870 and closed in 1962. It was a single track railway. The trains on the line were pulled by steam locomotives which used coal and water for their power. The trains carried passengers and freight. The freight was used by local factories and works. Coal was brought in to go to the shoe factories, peoples' homes and the gasworks. The coal that went to the peoples' homes was put into sacks at THORPE HOUSE FARM. The coal that went to the gasworks was heated up to make gas for the town. The old gasworks is now part of Raunds Tannery. All that is left now are the bridges, the embankments and the old station, which is now a private house. It is very pleasant to walk along the line.
